Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior glazed black with reserved band; exterior: trace of laurel wreath on rim with reserved band at junction with bowl; below, red-figure decoration consisting of possible satyr holding a sash (crown of his head with added white leaves in hair, right hand possibly holding a sash in faded added white remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0209) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 124, pl. LXVII, no. 9)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
